body.p: To display the SharePoint Browser view, go to Window Show View SharePoint Browser . This view allows you to connect to a SharePoint repository and perform SharePoint-specific actions on the available resources.
The view is split in several functional areas:

section.title: Connection Area
section.p: The Site combo box allows you to select and connect to an already defined SharePoint connection. The Disconnect action terminates the current connection. In addition to this, there are actions that help you to quickly define a new connection or manage the existing ones from the Data Source options page: New SharePoint Connection and Configure Database Sources.

section.title: Navigation Area
section.p: If there is no connection defined, this area is left blank and promotes two actions that allow you to add SharePoint connections.

When a connection is selected in the Connection Area, the Navigation Area displays the SharePoint site structure in a tree-like fashion organized in sites, libraries, and folders. The contextual menu of a node offers customized actions depending on the node type.

The contextual menu of a folder allows you to create new folders, new documents, and to rename and delete the folder. The rename and delete actions are not available for library root folders (folders located at first level in a SharePoint library).

body.p: The content of a folder selected in the tree is displayed in the right side table. The table columns are defined in the default view of the parent library. The rename and delete actions are available in the table viewâ€™s contextual menu both for documents and folders. You are able to check out, check in, and discard check out one or more documents at the same time. You can also filter and sort the displayed items. To display the available filters of a column, click the filter widget located on the column's header. You can apply multiple filters at the same time.A column can be filtered or sorted only if it was configured this way on the server side.
